verses.verse: Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about in the eleventh <S%H6249><s%> <S%H6240><s%> year, <S%H8141><s%> on the first <S%H259><s%> of the month, <S%H2320><s%> that the word <S%H1697><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to me saying, <S%H559><s%>

"Son <S%H1121><s%> of man, <S%H120><s%> because <S%H3282><s%> <S%H834><s%> Tyre <S%H6865><s%> has said <S%H559><s%> concerning <S%H5921><s%> Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> 'Aha, <S%H1889><s%> the gateway <S%H1817><s%> of the peoples <S%H5971><s%> is broken; <S%H7665><s%> it has opened <S%H5437><s%> to me. I shall be filled, <S%H4390><s%> [now that] she is laid <S%H2717><s%> waste, <S%H2717><s%>'

therefore, <S%H3651><s%> thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God, <S%H3068><s%> 'Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I am against <S%H5921><s%> you, O Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> and I will bring <S%H5927><s%> up many <S%H7227><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, as the sea <S%H3220><s%> brings <S%H5927><s%> up its waves. <S%H1530><s%>

'And they will destroy <S%H7843><s%> the walls <S%H2346><s%> of Tyre <S%H6865><s%> and break <S%H2040><s%> down <S%H2040><s%> her towers; <S%H4026><s%> and I will scrape <S%H5500><s%> her debris <S%H6083><s%> from her and make <S%H5414><s%> her a bare <S%H6706><s%> rock. <S%H5553><s%>

'She will be a place <S%H9298><s%> for the spreading <S%H9298><s%> of nets <S%H2764><s%> in the midst <S%H8432><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> for I have spoken, <S%H1696><s%>' declares <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God, <S%H3068><s%> 'and she will become <S%H1961><s%> spoil <S%H957><s%> for the nations. <S%H1471><s%>

'Also her daughters <S%H1323><s%> who <S%H834><s%> are on the mainland <S%H7704><s%> will be slain <S%H2026><s%> by the sword, <S%H2719><s%> and they will know <S%H3045><s%> that I am the Lord. <S%H3068><s%>' "

For thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God, <S%H3068><s%> "Behold, <S%H2009><s%> I will bring <S%H935><s%> upon Tyre <S%H6865><s%> from the north <S%H6828><s%> Nebuchadnezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of kings, <S%H4428><s%> with horses, <S%H5483><s%> chariots, <S%H7393><s%> cavalry, <S%H6571><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> army. <S%H5971><s%> <S%H6951><s%>

"He will slay <S%H2026><s%> your daughters <S%H1323><s%> on the mainland <S%H7704><s%> with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and he will make <S%H5414><s%> siege <S%H1785><s%> walls <S%H1785><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, cast <S%H8210><s%> up a mound <S%H5550><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you, and raise <S%H6965><s%> up a large <S%H6793><s%> shield <S%H6793><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> you.

"And the blow <S%H4239><s%> of his battering <S%H6904><s%> rams <S%H6904><s%> he will direct <S%H5414><s%> against your walls, <S%H2346><s%> and with his axes <S%H2719><s%> he will break <S%H5422><s%> down <S%H5422><s%> your towers. <S%H4026><s%>

"Because <S%H4480><s%> of the multitude <S%H8229><s%> of his horses, <S%H5483><s%> the dust <S%H80><s%> [raised by] them will cover <S%H3680><s%> you; your walls <S%H2346><s%> will shake <S%H7493><s%> at the noise <S%H6963><s%> of cavalry <S%H6571><s%> and wagons <S%H1534><s%> and chariots, <S%H7393><s%> when he enters <S%H935><s%> your gates <S%H8179><s%> as men enter <S%H3996><s%> a city <S%H5892><s%> that is breached. <S%H1234><s%>

"With the hoofs <S%H6541><s%> of his horses <S%H5483><s%> he will trample <S%H7429><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> your streets. <S%H2351><s%> He will slay <S%H2026><s%> your people <S%H5971><s%> with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and your strong <S%H5797><s%> pillars <S%H4676><s%> will come <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the ground. <S%H776><s%>

"Also they will make <S%H7997><s%> a spoil <S%H7997><s%> of your riches <S%H2428><s%> and a prey <S%H962><s%> of your merchandise, <S%H7404><s%> break <S%H2040><s%> down <S%H2040><s%> your walls <S%H2346><s%> and destroy <S%H5422><s%> your pleasant <S%H2532><s%> houses, <S%H1004><s%> and throw <S%H7760><s%> your stones <S%H68><s%> and your timbers <S%H6086><s%> and your debris <S%H6083><s%> into the water. <S%H4325><s%>

"So I will silence <S%H7673><s%> the sound <S%H1995><s%> of your songs, <S%H7892><s%> and the sound <S%H6963><s%> of your harps <S%H3658><s%> will be heard <S%H8085><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more. <S%H5750><s%>

"And I will make <S%H5414><s%> you a bare <S%H6706><s%> rock; <S%H5553><s%> you will be a place <S%H9298><s%> for the spreading <S%H9298><s%> of nets. <S%H2764><s%> You will be built <S%H1129><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> more, <S%H5750><s%> for I the Lord <S%H3068><s%> have spoken, <S%H1696><s%>" declares <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God. <S%H3068><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God <S%H3068><s%> to Tyre, <S%H6865><s%> "Shall not the coastlands <S%H339><s%> shake <S%H7493><s%> at the sound <S%H6963><s%> of your fall <S%H4658><s%> when the wounded <S%H2491><s%> groan, <S%H602><s%> when the slaughter <S%H2027><s%> occurs <S%H2026><s%> in your midst <S%H8432><s%>?

"Then all <S%H3605><s%> the princes <S%H5387><s%> of the sea <S%H3220><s%> will go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> from their thrones, <S%H3678><s%> remove <S%H5493><s%> their robes, <S%H4598><s%> and strip <S%H6584><s%> off <S%H6584><s%> their embroidered <S%H7553><s%> garments. <S%H899><s%> They will clothe <S%H3847><s%> themselves with trembling; <S%H2731><s%> they will sit <S%H3427><s%> on the ground, <S%H776><s%> tremble <S%H2729><s%> every moment, <S%H7281><s%> and be appalled <S%H8074><s%> at you.

"And they will take <S%H5375><s%> up a lamentation <S%H7015><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you and say <S%H559><s%> to you, 'How <S%H349><s%> you have perished, O inhabited <S%H6><s%> one, From the seas, <S%H3427><s%> O renowned <S%H3220><s%> city, <S%H1984><s%> Which <S%H5892><s%> was mighty <S%H834><s%> on the sea, <S%H2389><s%> She and her inhabitants, <S%H3220><s%> Who <S%H3427><s%> imposed <S%H834><s%> her terror <S%H5414><s%> On all <S%H2851><s%> her inhabitants! <S%H3605><s%>

'Now <S%H6258><s%> the coastlands <S%H339><s%> will tremble <S%H2729><s%> On the day <S%H3117><s%> of your fall; <S%H4658><s%> Yes, the coastlands <S%H339><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are by the sea <S%H3220><s%> Will be terrified <S%H926><s%> at your passing. <S%H3318><s%>' "

For thus <S%H3541><s%> says <S%H559><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God, <S%H3068><s%> "When I shall make <S%H5414><s%> you a desolate <S%H2717><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> like the cities <S%H5892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are not inhabited, <S%H3427><s%> when I shall bring <S%H5927><s%> up the deep <S%H8415><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> you, and the great <S%H7227><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> will cover <S%H3680><s%> you,

then I shall bring <S%H3381><s%> you down <S%H3381><s%> with those who go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit, <S%H953><s%> to the people <S%H5971><s%> of old, <S%H5769><s%> and I shall make you dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the lower <S%H8482><s%> parts <S%H8482><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> like the ancient <S%H5769><s%> waste <S%H2723><s%> places, <S%H2723><s%> with those who go <S%H3381><s%> down <S%H3381><s%> to the pit, <S%H953><s%> so <S%H4616><s%> that you will not be inhabited; <S%H3427><s%> but I shall set <S%H5414><s%> glory <S%H9469><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of the living. <S%H2416><s%>

"I shall bring <S%H5414><s%> terrors <S%H1091><s%> on you, and you will be no <S%H369><s%> more; <S%H369><s%> though you will be sought, <S%H1245><s%> you will never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5769><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> again, <S%H5750><s%>" declares <S%H5002><s%> the Lord <S%H136><s%> God. <S%H3068><s%>
